issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Add retry cache support in Namenode

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Currently the RetryInvocationHandler uses the same RPC ids (i.e., clientId + callId) only when the invocation is a RPC invocation. To check whether an invocation is RPC, RetryInvocationHandler#isRpcInvocation directly apply Proxy#isProxyClass on RetryInvocation#currentProxy. However, if currentProxy is an instance of ProtocolTranslator (e.g., ClientNamenodeProtocolTranslatorPB), the real dynamically-generated proxy object is contained within currentProxy and needs to be retrieved by calling ProtocolTranslator#getUnderlyingProxyObject. Failing to recognize a RPC invocation can cause a retry request to have different "clientId + callId" with its initial call, and fail to hit the corresponding retry cache entry in the NameNode side.

comments.body: Initial patch.
Update the patch to add a unit test. I put the test in TestRetryCacheWithHA which is to be used by HDFS-5025.

Thanks.  Patch looks good.  Are you going to use isRpcInvocation(..) in other packages so that you change it to public?  If yes, please add javadoc.
You're right, Nicholas. isRpcInvocation now does not need to be public. Update the patch to change it to default.
Hey Jing, change makes sense to me. One question: is this causing any acute problems? Any scenarios where you've actually scene this issue surface?
I actually think that you are going to use it somewhere.  If not, please also remove public from the RetryInvocationHandler class.  +1 after that.
Update the patch to remove "public" for RetryInvocationHandler.

Ah, got it. Makes sense. Thanks for the explanation.

Not a big deal, but in the future you might want to include a little explanation of the user-facing problem in the description of the JIRA, rather than just describing the code change. That way people like me won't have to ask. :)

bq. include a little explanation of the user-facing problem in the description of the JIRA

My bad.. I've update the description to provide more context information.
